section.name: Sample 430: Callout Mediator for Synchronous Web Service Invocations
section.div:
<definitions xmlns="http://ws.apache.org/ns/synapse">
<sequence name="main"> <callout serviceURL="http://localhost:9000/services/SimpleStockQuoteService" action="urn:getQuote"> <source xmlns:s11="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:s12="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xpath="s11:Body/child::*[fn:position()=1] | s12:Body/child::*[fn:position()=1]"/> <target xmlns:s11="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:s12="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xpath="s11:Body/child::*[fn:position()=1] | s12:Body/child::*[fn:position()=1]"/> </callout> <respond/> </sequence>
</definitions>

subsection.name: Objective
subsection.p: Demonstrate the usage of the callout mediator for making synchronous (blocking) Web service calls during mediation

ul.li: Deploy the SimpleStockQuoteService in the sample Axis2 server and start Axis2

Start Synapse using the configuration numbered 430 (repository/conf/sample/synapse_sample_430.xml)
Unix/Linux: sh synapse.sh -sample 430
Windows: synapse.bat -sample 430

subsection.name: Executing the Client
subsection.p: In this sample, the callout mediator does the direct service invocation to the StockQuoteService using the client request, gets the response and sets it as the first child of the SOAP message body. Then using the send mediator, the message is sent back to the client. As a result there is no need to define any endpoints in this configuration.
